1.text: And Job continued his parable and said,

2.text: [As] God liveth, who hath taken away my right, and the Almighty, who hath embittered my soul,

3.text: All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of +God is in my nostrils,

4.text: My lips shall not speak unrighteousness, nor my tongue utter deceit!

5.text: Be it far from me that I should justify you; till I die I will not remove my blamelessness from me.

6.text: My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go: my heart reproacheth [me] not one of my days.

7.text: Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.

8.text: For what is the hope of the ungodly, when [God] cutteth him off, when +God taketh away his soul?

9.text: Will God hear his cry when distress cometh upon him?

10.text: Doth he delight himself in the Almighty? will he at all times call upon +God?

11.text: I will teach you concerning the hand of God; what is with the Almighty will I not conceal.

12.text: Behold, ye yourselves have all seen [it]; and why are ye thus altogether vain?

13.text: This is the portion of the wicked man with God, and the heritage of the violent, which they receive from the Almighty:â€”

14.text: If his children be multiplied, it is for the sword, and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread;

15.text: Those that remain of him shall be buried by death, and his widows shall not weep.

16.text: Though he heap up silver as the dust, and prepare clothing as the clay;

17.text: He may prepare it, but the just shall put it on; and the innocent shall divide the silver.

18.text: He buildeth his house as the moth, and as a booth that a keeper maketh.

19.text: He lieth down rich, but will do so no more; he openeth his eyes, and he is not.

20.text: Terrors overtake him like waters; a whirlwind stealeth him away in the night.

21.text: The east wind carrieth him away and he is gone; and as a storm it hurleth him out of his place.

22.text: And [God] shall cast upon him and not spare: he would fain flee out of his hand.

23.text: [Men] shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.
